steps.title: Database Auto-Connection
steps.content: When you run the app, the datasource plugin will check for a database in your runner. If one exists, it will be automatically connected.

steps.title: We have launched the App
steps.content:
Codenvy launches a Docker container for each run. Docker containers are isolated processes that contain the software to run your code. Your project’s code and artifacts are copied into the runner automatically. When the runner has finished loading, the application preview URL will appear.
Console applications will display output in the console panel.

steps.title: Discover the Datasource
steps.content:
Open the Datasource Explorer panel.
Once the application is started, select Runner-DS-spring-petclinic-... to browse the connected database

steps.title: Explore the Database
steps.content: Explore the database’s tables and schema. We’ve opened the requests.sql file for you - you’ll use it in the next step to make a change.

steps.title: Create SQL Request
steps.content:
In requests.sql add a request to get all entries from the Pets SQL table. Add the following line to the end of the file:
SELECT * FROM petclinic.pets INNER JOIN petclinic.owners ON owner_id = owners.id
You can use ‘ctrl+space’ to get syntax-completion on SQL statements. Save the file when you’re done.

steps.title: Execute SQL Request
steps.content: Select the SQL statement and hit “Execute Query” to process your request and see the pets and their owners in “Query Results” section.

steps.title: Try Your Own Database
steps.content: You can add your own database by adding it to a Docker container (our docs discuss how to create custom Docker environments).  You will need a Codenvy account for this.
